body_html:
https://privacyspy.org/product/ruqqus/

We are failing in regards to providing law enforcement too much theoretical access to personal user data, data breach notifications, history of policies, lack of transparency, not listing on policy page what personal data is collected (Kek has confirmed it is quite a bit based on the userdata page), providing no justification for collecting and storing those specific datapoints, collecting data from third party sources and allowing third party critical service providers to access user data.

@kek @captainmeta4 @arkitekt
title: Ruqqus - rated 4.2/10 for privacy | PrivacySpy -- looks like some work needs to be done.

post.body_html:
https://privacyspy.org/product/ruqqus/

We are failing in regards to providing law enforcement too much theoretical access to personal user data, data breach notifications, history of policies, lack of transparency, not listing on policy page what personal data is collected (Kek has confirmed it is quite a bit based on the userdata page), providing no justification for collecting and storing those specific datapoints, collecting data from third party sources and allowing third party critical service providers to access user data.

@kek @captainmeta4 @arkitekt
post.title: Ruqqus - rated 4.2/10 for privacy | PrivacySpy -- looks like some work needs to be done.

body:
The easiest reasonable fixes are probably:

* At a minimum, there should probably be a last modified date in the privacy policy. Ideally revisions, or a changelog.
* The users should probably be notified when the privacy policy is changed.
* It should at least be somewhat clear why personal data is collected (e.g. need your email for notifications, IP address / browser identifiers to help with ban mitigation etc)
* The types of data collected should be explained in the privacy policy

Parts I think are bullshit and/or are outright wrong:

> Does the service collect personal data from third parties?  Yes
* The quote shared from the policy is: "We will share your data with our own service providers which are necessary for ruqqus.com operations.". This has nothing to do with collecting personal data from third parties

Things I think Ruqqus shouldn't change:

> When does the policy allow law enforcement access to personal data?  When reasonably requested

The relevant quote from policy is: "At our discretion, Ruqqus may share your information with United States law enforcement in the event of an emergency, if we have good cause to believe that doing so would avert or mitigate the emergency.", and in my opinion is appropriate.
body_html:
The easiest reasonable fixes are probably:

  • At a minimum, there should probably be a last modified date in the privacy policy. Ideally revisions, or a changelog.
  • The users should probably be notified when the privacy policy is changed.
  • It should at least be somewhat clear why personal data is collected (e.g. need your email for notifications, IP address / browser identifiers to help with ban mitigation etc)
  • The types of data collected should be explained in the privacy policy

Parts I think are bullshit and/or are outright wrong:

Does the service collect personal data from third parties? Yes

  • The quote shared from the policy is: "We will share your data with our own service providers which are necessary for ruqqus.com operations.". This has nothing to do with collecting personal data from third parties

Things I think Ruqqus shouldn't change:

When does the policy allow law enforcement access to personal data? When reasonably requested

The relevant quote from policy is: "At our discretion, Ruqqus may share your information with United States law enforcement in the event of an emergency, if we have good cause to believe that doing so would avert or mitigate the emergency.", and in my opinion is appropriate.

https://privacyspy.org/product/ruqqus/

We are failing in regards to providing law enforcement too much theoretical access to personal user data, data breach notifications, history of policies, lack of transparency, not listing on policy page what personal data is collected (Kek has confirmed it is quite a bit based on the userdata page), providing no justification for collecting and storing those specific datapoints, collecting data from third party sources and allowing third party critical service providers to access user data.

@kek @captainmeta4 @arkitekt
post.title: Ruqqus - rated 4.2/10 for privacy | PrivacySpy -- looks like some work needs to be done.

parent.body:
> At a minimum, there should probably be a last modified date in the privacy policy. Ideally revisions, or a changelog.

There [technically is](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/commits/master/ruqqus/templates/help/privacy.html).
parent.body_html:
At a minimum, there should probably be a last modified date in the privacy policy. Ideally revisions, or a changelog.

There technically is.

We are failing in regards to providing law enforcement too much theoretical access to personal user data, data breach notifications, history of policies, lack of transparency, not listing on policy page what personal data is collected (Kek has confirmed it is quite a bit based on the userdata page), providing no justification for collecting and storing those specific datapoints, collecting data from third party sources and allowing third party critical service providers to access user data.
